description: read prunus girl from start to finish using this program. meow

I like the app, and the servers make getting various entries very conveinent, though i have a couple complaints:
adding local files is a little broken (each comic/manga needs to have its own folder, then you add that folder by searching for it in the local server, then the program creates another folder in that folder that you need to move the files in up a directory for thumbnails to work), editing titles, synopses, chapter titles, etc is non existant, scrolling between pages has a large delay that can't be disabled or lowered, there's no duel-page view, and you can't pan when zoomed in by clicking and dragging. It would also be nice to get a couple more providers, like maybe even sourcing from torrents for higher quality from trackers like nyaa.si. The provided trackers are good to check out a comic/manga, but the typically low quality bugs me for titles i know i care about.

It works really neatly, but there are a few things that bug me with it.

1) It's single-threaded and written in python. It is terrible in performance, it just squeezes one core of the CPU, and it can become unresponsive presumably because of that.

2) It crashes without crashing. Sometimes, after prolonged use, especially after downloading a lot of manga, it can just refuse to quit normally, so I have to kill it through other means. This is very frustrating.

3) It lacks some nice features. I'd like to browse through Komikku, I'd like to check a mangaka's other works, but I can't. I can use it in conjunction with a browser, but I can't use it on its own for reading. Not the worst thing, but it kinda bothers me.

4) It doesn't show all search results. It sometimes seems to cut search results early, and that can make it hard to find the manga I want to add. That does cause a big problem, perhaps the second or third biggest problem after 1) and 2).

5) It could use some more features. On the one hand, I like that it doesn't just grab tags willy-nilly from sites, as so many sites apply terribly wrong tags when they do, and don't apply them all. On the other hand, I feel like it could accelerate the process of getting acclimated to Komikku as someone who has already read a fair share of manga.

6) It could still use some more features! It would be nice if it could import lists from sites. Not much more to say about that.

I could maybe think of a few more things, but yeah, the biggest gripe I have with it is the performance. I still love reading with Komikku, but it is a pain to see what should be incredibly lightweight hog my CPU, or at least one of its cores.

The performance may best be fixed by using a different language - Rust and Go would probably be similarly comfortable, but much better in performance - but whatever you do, please at least make it multi-threaded, it would greatly benefit its performance, and, by extension, usability.
summary: Great, but could be much better

Does not work with mamgalib.me

Хорошее приложение, полностью устраивает как по функционалу, так и по дизайну. Идеология программы совпадает с философией простоты дизайна и функциональностью удобства приложений GNOME. Особых недочетов не заметил, разве что сервер мангалиб плохо работает в данном приложение, но в нем есть большой список разных серверов, который пополняется, для скачивания манги, по этому это не так важно. Могу отметить то, что во множества серверов не нужно авторизоваться, дабы пользоваться ими, и сам процесс загрузки манги происходит не заметно, от этого использовать приложение более приятнее.
